instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2850: What is 820-2850? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.C9560: What is C9560? Tantalum capacitor on 820-2850 logic board that often dies and causes intermittent power to framebuffer PP1V8R1V55_S0GPU_ISNS and PP1V8R1V55_S0GPU_ISNS_R rail, causing GPU kernel panics. Replace with non-tantalum if machine is having random black screen or kernel panics.
definitions.A1286: What is A1286? A1286 is a model number for a 15 inch size MacBook Pro Unibody from years Late 2008, Mid 2009, Mid 2009 , Mid 2010, Early 2011, Late 2011, Mid 2012 with EMC 2255, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-2330, 820-2532, 820-2523, 820-2533, 820-2850, 820-2915, 820-3330..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No boot. VCore at .8V
threads.message: NO CHime. NO beep without ram cards installed. No data activity on USB port. Changed <CAPACITOR>C9560</CAPACITOR> and BIOS. Is this probably brain dead being it drops to .8V on VCOre but no activity?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No boot. VCore at .8V
threads.message:
Any history available?
VCORE drops without RAM module too?
Where did you get the BIOS for test?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No boot. VCore at .8V
threads.message:
No just quit on the customer... I assumed it was the typical cap at first. No signs of liquid on the board. 

Vcore does go to .8V without the Ram cards.

Had a BIOS in my files for 2850 that I tried after I noticed odd symptoms of Vcore voltage to .8V with no boot

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No boot. VCore at .8V
threads.message:
I'm not confident on the clean file I have. ANy chance you could clean?

[URL unfurl="true"]https://drive.google.com/file/d/1xoGMEhuRH625ulAFdfiwWW2uJq5bf0Hg/view?usp=sharing[/URL]

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No boot. VCore at .8V
threads.message:
<CAPACITOR>C9560</CAPACITOR> issue still allows the machine to boot.
It also normally boots without clean ME.

Try and comment...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No boot. VCore at .8V
threads.message:
Thanks for those. I couldn't get either to work:
APPLE <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1286</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> MLB <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A OK.bin = no start. SMC bypass would try to start and cycle.
PCT25VF032B_20160916_185643.BIN = I get a verification error after erase/write after a couple of attempts.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No boot. VCore at .8V
threads.message:
I ended up replacing the firmware chip and using the PC25F032B BIOS you sent. No change but as last resort, I gave it a bath in the USC and it came back to life. Passed diagostics and stress testing. :)

Thanks!
